london printed william stans henrie fetherstone sold shoppe paul churchyard signe rose 1613 reverend father god george divine providence lord archbishop canterbvrie primate metropolitane england one maiesties honourable priuie covncell reuerend dutie make bold euen first looking leaping dungeon obscuritie hitherto inclosed interrupt serious affaire view labour worth worthinesse causeth presumption rather present firstfruits vnto high priest hee might shake lord make acceptable neither meeter patronise historie religion whose person religion giueth mutually receiueth patronage therefore meanest leuis sonnes doe offer vnto grace asia africa america withered fouler hue passed outworne rite present irreligious religion washed purer streames sacred baptisme evrope challengeth roome kind selfe would christian historie vouchsafe stranger holy companie therefore hath enioyned second pilgrimage perambulation ouer world trace footstep obserue euery planter corrupters reformer great burthen atwofold world requires atlas hercules vndergoe newnesse also make difficult enterprise neuer yet knowledge language attempted conioyning thus antiquitie moderne history obseruations rarity world especially soule world religion yet haue aduentured speake boast excuse selfe haughtie designes first voyage discouerie besides mine owne poore stocke laide thereon hath made mee indebted seuen hundred author one kind know many hundred treatise epistle relation history diuers subiects language borrowed selfe besides want author themselues haue taken vpon trust men good hand wherein enioyed academicke leisure 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 benefit greater library conference men skilful braine might haue yeelded fairer issue compleate betterarmed minerua besides want daily care family weekly dueties preaching catechising ministerie grossenesse aire liue say make duller wit sure sicklier body maypleade excuse clade authore leuatur world weight presseth booke shall haue praise greatest dispraise magnis tamen excidit ausis howsoeuer shall thinke selfe happie grace examination censure impietie offer intercept interposition line eclipse gracious aspect influence vnto church state though grace cannot necessarie imployments needes knowing better alreadie afford precious time thing baser worth yet recreation shall vouchsafe remembrancers labour refresh shall bee sufficiently recompenced others may hence learne laborious though mostlearned argument induction two lesson fitting time vnnaturalnesse faction atheisme law nature hauing written practise men kind last resolued turne pleasure study studious paine others might againe delightfull studie turne paine pleasure bring religion paradise arke thence follow round world sake obserue world selfe find relation historian passe worthie writing religion proper aime therefore insist longer description whatsoeuer finde belonging thereto declaring religion first men corrupting floud lewish first exhibiteth relation theologicall discouerie asia africa america second god shall doe evrope third fourth second visitation shall obserue thing place hold remarkeable christian ecclesiasticall historie according method squared whole order place going still one countrie next particular part seuerall countrie order time deducing relation farre wee haue others footprint guide v though exactly naming day yeare determining question chronologicall controuerfies yet conuenient sort ancient time degree descending present thou demaundest profit may bèe hereof answere student sort may find matter fitting study naturall philosopher may obserue different constitution commixtion element diuerse working diuerse place varietie heauenly influence yearely season creature aire water earth delight stateaffaires may obserue varietie state kingdomes differing lawes politics customes beginning ending diuine besides former may contemplate workes god creation alone iustice prouidence pursuing sinne euery dreadfull plague bodily rooting vp pulling downe mightiest empire especially spirituall iudgments giuing vp great part world vnto efficacie errour strong delusion hauing forsaken fountaine liuing water digge vnto themselues broken pittes hold water deuout superstition superstitiuous deuotions agreeing bee religion disagreeing trvth practise thereof likewise minister may bee incited vnto godly labour function preaching gospell seeing otherwise outward bodily ceremony turkes iewes manifold deuotions oratory euery day heathen would conuince v idlenesse let mee haue leaue speake glorie god good church cannot find priestes pilgrimage wee haue exact historie take bodily paine deuotions performed notpreaching minister especially countrievillages weeke day cannot haue occasion companie publique prayer therefore onely read seruice neuer studie would idle practise euen heathen shall rise vp judgment subscribe hand practise liturgie lethargie whose darknesse much intolerable sunshine gospell wherein wee haue gratious king diligent frequenter sermon reuerend bishop notwithstanding weightie ecclesiasticall employment yet diligent preacher studious geographie may somewhat helped kind soundeth sacred name iesvs professe infinite sectes superstition god hath shewed word vnto iacob defender faith statute iudgments vnto israel great britaine hath dealt euery nation neither haue heathen scarsely sarcely christian nation much knowledge iudgments yet seditious prophane vnthankfull beastly sinne drunkennesse biting sinne vsurie deuilish sinne swaggering ruffling deformitie clothes like monstrous chimaera barking multiformitie oathes like hellish cerberi men could gallant vnlesse turned deuils payment returne vnto lord instead prayer loialtie maiestie peaceablenesse discretion easily conceiue doe euerie question set downe censure sometimes needes sometimes difficultie mention authours sometimes meane qualitie meanest haue sense obserue themselues see certainly without effect make reader staie obseruation wonder besides varietie selfe delightsome mislike fulnesse place barrennesse wordes others let consider wee handle world mountaines vallies fertile habitation sandie desarts others step follow hold sometimes narrower way elsewhere take libertie touch sometimes controuersie illustration historie season season shew affection truth man thinke better rotten bone passed stinking body present superstition buried thus raked graues besides hath beene said answere haue sufficient example scripture written learning end world yet depaint vnto v vgly face pag746 catalogue author haue mustered thy view courteous reader author mine owne sight haue mentioned worke confesse great note noted notorious counterfeit vse meet placed may haue due thankefulnesse worthie great industrie wherein deserue place though otherwise obscure nauigations discoueries haue made world knowne selfe others may knowne lie meere changeling rather induced guie thee table name nothing impression hath escaped faultie missenaming besides haue author rightly placed margin shall finde neare place marginall misseplacing author thought good giue notice fault except hast presse hath caused judicious reader may easily see amend acknowledge ramusius hakluyt bookes voyage haue beene two library vnto many nauigations discoueries mentioned kind sacred prophane learned vnlearned ancient moderne good bad haue toyled selfe benefit thee hundred could haue added catalogue follow others example mention booke hauing nothing new cause would namelesse could besides borrowed second language whereof citie named babylon according moses gene 11 9 therefore name called babel lord confound language earth thence lord scatter vpon earth atheist naturalist dreame world eternall conceiue men could one diuersitie language beene hierusalem heard apostle expertest men owne vulgar speake language might haue seene like powerin contrary effect babylon man sinne caused god mercie one came babylon ierusalem old ierusalem giuing taste earnest new ierusalem shal fully accomplish shalbe made new shall become one god shalbe appeereth builder lost vnderstanding owne speach indued language whereto vnderstandings tongue framed stead former former language hath bin doubted either ignorance curiositie selfloue theodor q 59 gen esteemeth syrian first language hebrew began moses taught god iesuites epistle declare made like triall thirty child caused without hearing man brought vp setting guard obserue nurse speake purposing religion whereto addict themselues neither could euer speake thou knowst thy selfe please thine appetite present dainty death yeeld thee delight loe dust whilome prince might eate haue greetly minde consumd much ala sweet left behinde learne man thus liue best wisedome thou canst finde legacie hee hath bequeathed epicure liuing sepulchre themselues breathing graues many creature onely better themselues deuoure reason nature religion soule possible god lie 575 taher sonne 621 next mestenatzar gaue much almes built many schooles dayes arose asia one baba professed himselfe prophet sent god gathered armie scumme nation whereby filled asia bloud slaughter christian israelite vntill glatheddin king gunia destroyed yeare 640 christ one thousand two hundred forty two succeeded musteatzem foure fiftieth saracenicall chalipha tartar king chita made brother halacho king irak mesopotamia besieged sacked bagded slew musteatzem chalipha starued commaundement middest treasure hee would employ niggardise owne defence time hath beene chaliph saith arabian history bagded ended abasian line beene fiue thirty chaliphaes mahumet muhammed false prophet first captaines warre called emirelmumenim say praefecti orthodoxorum captaines soundbeleeuers vnder cloake religion seised primacie tyranny spirituall temporall named themselues chaliphaes vicar first emirelmumenim abubecher successor gouernours gouernors chorasan irak siras damasco ie •• n mutzul halep gunia mahaan arabian calleth king heir succeeded sent spaine africa time held deputy although power nothing lacked title king yet professed doe name emirelmumenim vntill afterwardes tooke title also themselues became absolute whence pettite king spaine african potentate called emire elmumenim king barbary stilled day euen french king called christianissimus spaniard catholicus legate chalipha called naibin also signifieth chalipha made peculiar saracen tyrant vsed sword speake roman language supreame matter diuine humane thus obserueth ioseph scaliger isagl3 name whereby appeareth emire elmumenim giuen onely abedramon successours africa obserued curio thus haue wee giuen chronographicall view auncient chaliphaes first greatest conquest omitting lesser later yeare 807 sardinia corsica 826 creete 843 sicill presently ludreglib8 italy ouerrunning tuscan burning suburb rome selfe church peter paul 845 next yeare illyria dalmatia besides taking ancona 847 chased pope plat • vita pont leo ostia affaire warre lucania calabria apulia beneuentum genu capua city tooke passe ouer great body grew lubberly vnweldy fell vnder weight selfe none much saracen ouerthrowing saracen cairaoan became papacie absolute though schismatical called marocco persian always p • one schismes others serued aduantage sect diuisions make plaine neuerthelesse disjoyning disjoynting notwithstanding religion euen still couereth great part world besides triumphing sword turke persian mogore barbarian mahumetan prince zeale superstitious mahumetane place furthest distant religion hath beene preached trade together marchandise euen atlantike ocean vnto philippinaes hath founded china hath pierced tartaria although name christian extendeth selfe many sect profession country asia africke america besides europe almost wholly christian yet hard say whether many disciple professours ridiculous impious deuotion giue name christ whatsoeuer truth heresie thus hath field church haue sacrificed son pephilops diuine power releeued thou art like finde tantalus still poet tell ganymede euery one knowes niobe famous sonnes daughter lost one day mydas another tantalus whose couetousnes became new alchymie fable mydas hauing wish granted wished touched might become golde meate golde starued turne golde doth twofould alchymie gull world one making vaine hope rich estate become poore full hap making gold man onely romane la noue discourse alchimist maister art former professe turnes easily little lead much good gold onely wise man wise later bee maister himselfe gordius midas might behold shaft became gordius cart indissoluble knot fastned therto great fame therof amongst next adioining people gordius one auncient inhabitant phrygia hauing little place ground two yoke ox one vsed plough waine cart hee one day plough eagle sate vpon yoke continued till euening gordius astonished ominous token went telmissean soothsayer telmissean men woman diuining science seemed haereditary met virgin acquainted accident counselled returne thither sacrifice iupiter king augury good gordius entreated company might instruct sacrifice shee granted vnto afterwards selfe also marriage betwixt midas proper stripling sedition happening among phrygian consulted oracle answered cart bring king end sedition while musing answere midas came riding cart parent throng phrygian forthwith acknowledged king carre memory hereof hāged vp iupiter tower temple iupiter qu curtl3 cursius calleth thanks eagle iupiters bird sent foresignifie thus much father knot fastned vnto barke comell doggetree wouen arte man could neither finde beginning ende thereof bruted amongst phrygian could vntie lord asia alexander turning fro vaine curiositie searching loosen last sword chopped asia sometime store sometimes want conuenient matter detaining penne one time consumer thing causing much time paine spent curious search might produce light darknesse store story varietie varying author hath dimmed weaker eye much light vncertaine many tract tractats begin end last wee passed euphrates countrey often exalteth selfe though would pierce sky often receiueth due punishment ambitious pride cast downe many lowly valleyes deiected bottomes world floud repeopled hence still carrieth seuerall age place people men thereof resemblance cradle vp varietie vicissitude chaunce change constant vnconstancie treading armenian measure vnequall pace ouer hils dale like selfe onely vnlikenesse no arke setled must shippe hoyse sayle armenia hath part cappadocia euphrates west mesopotamia south north part colchis iberia albania east caspian sea medium part greater armenia called turcomania part contained georgia ptolomey ptoll5c13 reckoneth principall mountaines moschici antonius armenius haithon beleeue owne countrey royall linage calleth mountaine arath little differing scriptureappellation ararat addeth although regard abundance snow alway possessing toppe thereof none able goe vp thither yet alway appeareth toppe certaine blacke thing vulgar people esteeme arke armenia strabo lib 11 affirmeth receiued name one iasons companion followed nauigation harmenia citie thessalie betweene pherae larissa wealth region appeared ptolomey appointed tigranes bring romanes sixe thousand talent siluer added voluntarily beyond summe euery souldior campe fiftie drammes siluer euery centurion thousand euery deputie countrey chiliarche talent religion must first noah familie professed time corrupted pseudo berosus lib3 sayth berosus noah instructed posteritie diuine humane science committed many naturall secret vnto writing scythian armenian commend priest onely none else suffered see reade teach left also rituall bookes ceremoniall tearmed saga priest bishop greater lesse god soule world mouing heauen creature man god peace iustice holinesse putting away hurtfull thing preseruing good cause nation signifie writing course sunne motion moone scepter dominion persecuting chasing away wicked among societie men chastitie bodie sanctimonie minde two keyes religion happinesse called also wife noah tidea mother death aretia earth esta fire beene queene hee found planted vine therefore called ianus aramaean soundeth much author wine thus farre berosus lib 3 fourth booke addeth nymbrot first saturne babylon sonne iupiter belus stole away rituall ceremoniall bookes iupiter sagus came people land sennaar appointed citie layed foundation great tower hundred one thirtie yeares floud neither finished founded olde ianus went hence left scytha persian turk haue successiuely vexed coūtries farre shamaki saith master ienkinson hak voyag tom1 old castle called gullistone beaten downe sophi farre thence nunry sumptuous building wherein buried king daughter named ameleck chauna slew selfe knife father would haue forced shee professing chastitie haue married tartar king vpon occasion maiden euery yere resort thither mourne death also high hill called quiquifs vpon top whereof asabulous report medes say dwelleth giant named arneoste hauing head two great horne eares eye like horse taile like cow kept passage thereby till one haucoir hamshe holy man bound woman lamisache sonne therefore saintlike reputation obdolowcan king countrey vnder sophie besides gratious entertainment granted vnto master anthonie ienkinson english merchant world scythian exile time assyrian medes persian macedonian obscure people prey euery conquerour seemed diuide world roman speech mixt median scythian army consisted part seruants held great respect instructing feat armes armie fiftie thousand wherewith encountred antony onely 800 freeman parthian iustin41 vse gold siluer armor many wiues whereof iealous forbad sight men performed busines priuate publike horsebacke distinction freeman seruants burial belly bird dog naked bone couered earth exceedingly superstitious worshippe god stout vnquiet seditious vnfaithfull people arsaces first famous theefe founder kingdome left lesse memorie himselfe amongst parthian cyrus among persian alexander among macedonian day wherein ouerthrew seleucus solemnely obserued euery yeare amongst beginning liberty called king arsaces roman emperours named caesar ammarlib23 called themselues brother sunne moone place worshipped arsaces worshipped death lesse bloudy brother came crowne ottoman day phrahartes iustinlib42 slew thirty brother father sonne rather would endure possibility competitor vadianus sec fol5 228 yeres christ artabanus last persian king slaine artaxeres artaxares persian senate magi wisemen ancient religious rite find particularly related parthian affaire thus iustinlib41 dion cassius lib4 • pius secundus asia gramaye parthica pbiz ru rerum persicaramlib30 related alexander death none macedonian vouchsafing meane prouince stragonor forreiner obtained macedonian contending ciuill quarrel soueraignety parthia wauered vncertaintie till time soleucus nephew antiochus theodotus deputie cachia entituled himselfe king giuing example rebellion easterne nation arsaces among parthian easily followed combining theodotus death sonne strengthened new erected gouernement two city seleucus taking armes ouerthrowne battell day first gaue light parthian greatnesse vnworthily obserued therefore posteritie solemnity seleucus important affaire called home parthian leasure establish hope athenaeus reporteth arsaces tooke prisoner gentle vsage sent home first came second arsaces encountered antiochus sonne seleucus comming armie hundred thousand footman twentie thousand horse issue parted friend mutuall league priapatius pampatius third king phraates sonne succeeded next brother mithradates subdued medes helimaeans enlarging parthian empire mount caucasus euphrates tooke demetriu king syria prisoner died old age sonne phraates fourth antiochus warred parthian opposed brother demetrius till detained prisoner while warred scythian treason owne subiects slaine artabanus vncle placed roome also soone died wound receiued field sonne mithridates succeeded parthian senate expelled deposed others reckon betweene artabanus mithridates pacorus killed wife sonne eies hauing remained performe vnto last vncouth vnnaturall seruice presently put himselfe imprisoned varamus little beene sent generall romane armie seruice found vnseruiceable recouered kingdome aide empire nicephorus de chosroe mauritio lege nicephl17 18 witnesseth deepely seene chaldaean mysleries romane gouernour reproued excesse time much needed helpe answered time aduantage reproofes know saith calamity shall also befall romanes babylonian nation shall rule three weekes yeares fifth weeke romanes shall subdue persian come passe day shall come shall haue night expected end empire shall hand time corruption shall bee abolished men shall liue according diuine ordinance either false vncertaine prophecie according deepenesse sathan vttered effect answerable hath followed know cosroes raigned nine thirtie yeares hee held peace romanes while mauritius liued phoca cruelly treacherously slaine world euils assaulted empire germanes gaules italian hunnes persian army afflicted publike state roman bishop began aspire vniuersall soueraignetie murtherer first entitled vnto armie yet redde bloud mauritius persian sword punished died owne bloud hauing ouerthrowne romanes two battailes possessed mesopotamia syria aegypt palaestina phoenicia entred ierusalem slew captiued many christian bizari l6 carried thence crosse iberian armenian cappadocians galatian paphlagonians euen vnto chalcedon hee preuailed thus god punish murtherer besides pay owne coyne priscus heraclon heraclius conspired conspirer murthered murtherer hauing cut priuities head hurled sea destroyed issue heraclius succeeded repressed cosroes vnto whose power carthage africa also subiected inuaded conducting army aegypt heraclius sends embassage receiued answere would neuer stroke death hee told white camell would come bodie accordingly came carried dead body sword therewith taken vp heauen whose returne haue long looked persia cause king kept horse readie sadled kept euery morning afternoone goe vp toppes church tell great tale mahomet mortus ali haue also among certaine holy men called setes accounted therefore holy ancestor haue beene pilgrimage mecca must belieued saintship although lie neuer shamefully setes vse shaue head ouer sauing side little aboue temple leaue vnshauen vse braid woman doe haire weare long grow io barb apud ramus iosafa barbaro sammachi lodged hospitall wherein graue vnder vault stone neere vnto man beard haire long naked sauing little behind couered skin sitting peece matte ground saith saluted demanded told watched father asked father quoth doth good neighbour man sepulchre haue liued thirtie yeares accompany death dead buried haue seene world sufficient haue determined abide thus till death another found tauris allsoules day also vsed commemoration soules departed neere sepulchre churchyard hauing many bird especially rauens crowes thought beene dead corpse told liuing saint whose call bird resorted gaue meate another saw assambei armenia marching persia signior iausa lord persia zagatai vnto citie herem drew staffe dish wherein ate said certaine word brake sultan demanded hee said heard answered said victorious breake enemy force broken dish whereupon commanded kept till returne finding euent according vsed honorably sultan rode field set mule hand bound sometime accustomed doe dangerous folly foot attended many religious person called daruise madde trickes vsed according course moone sometimes two three dayes eating thing busied foolery faine binde great allowance expense one holy men went naked like beast preaching faith hauing obtained great reputation caused himselfe immured wall fortie dayes abide without sustenance time expired wondered one nosewise rest smelled sent flesh sultan hearing committed disciple cadilasher torment caused confesse cousinage thorow hole made wall caue broth conueyed therefore put death yeare 1478 chozamirech armenian shop tauris azi saint came willed deny christian faith answered courteously prayed trouble persisted offered money saint would haue mony importuned first sute chozumirech said hee would deny christian faith whereupon plucked sword man scaba • stood wound gaue armenian head killed ranne away armenian sonne complaining sultan procured apprehension •• meren two dayes iourney tauris brought knife killed owne hand caused cast dunghill dogges eat saying way encrease faith mahomet zealous people went one daruiscassun guarding sepulchre assambei former sultan prior hospitall requesting obtained bodie burie sultan hearing sent said darest thou countermaund commaunds away kill suddenly dispatched reuenged people committed towne sacke space three foure houres done forbad spoile fined towne great summe gold lastly caused armenian sonne come many kind word comforted long history haue inserted shew extremity blinde zeale religious furie secular votary persian instire withstand rage mentioned commemoration dead thus performed ouer sepulchre thither resort great multitude men woman old yong sit heapes priest candle lighted priest either reade pray language cause brought somewhat eat place place containeth betweene foure continued royall inuestiture succeeding soueraignes exceeding rich conquest notwithstanding two solemnity saith author selfe haue beene present cangius thus inthronized felt commanded many thing first beleeue immortall god thence forward tartar beganne call vpon name immortall god seeking aide enterprise secondly commanded make generall view able beare armes appointing captaines ouer tennes ouer thousand ouer ten thousand made full regiment hee commanded also seuen principall head tribe bereaue themselues dignity triall obedience bring thither eldest sonne cut head owne hand refused doe reuerence diuine ordinance whereby made soueraigne cangius hauing thus made triall fidelitie subdued many nation one day hauing horse slaine battell vnder forsaken tartar despairing recouery saw fall might easily haue beene slaine enemy ignorance neglected pursue rest cangius perceiuing conueyed himselfe thicket shrubbes enemy returned despoile dead owle came sate shrubbe vnder cangius hidden caused suspect lurke departed next night fled people seeing hearing order escape gaue thankes immortall god meanes bird preserued also owle obserued fowle reuerence accounted happie thing weare one fethers head cangius afterwards assaulting enemy brought vnder country side belgian exact time thing haithon could learne notwithstanding much inquirie hee imputeth want letter time country thus conquered armed man appeared second time commanded name immortall god passe mountaine belgian go toward west conquer kingdomes seignories land thou mayest assured god arise goe thy people towards mountaine part ioyneth sea thou shalt dismount turne thee toward east kneeling downe nine time shalt worshippe immortall god almightie shall shew thee way thou mayest commodiously passe cangius especially molten siluer vndermining tartar made way armie middest citie issued vp opened gate force slew citizen first time emperour kythayans vanquished cyngis cham obtained empire men kytay kytayans religion pagan hauing speciall kinde writing themselues reported scripture old new testament haue also recorded history liues forefather haue eremite certaine house made manner church dayes greatly resorted vnto say haue diuerse saint also worship one god adore reuerence christ iesvs lord beleeue article eternall life baptized doe also honorably esteeme reuerence scripture loue christian bestow much almes courteous gentle people haue beard agree partly mongals disposition countenance better artificer world countrey exceeding rich corne wine gold silke commodity conquest cathay cyngis sent sonne thossut tearmed also people comania whome vanquished another sonne hee sent indian subdued india minor indian blacke saracen blacke saracen also called aethiopians thence marched fight christian dwelling india maior whose king commonly called presbyter iohn stratageme repelled dominion trauelling homewards said armie mongals came vnto land buirthabeth inhabitant whereof pagan conquered people bartaile people haue strange custome man father dieth assembleth kindred eat haue beard yron instrument plucke haires grow cyngis himselfe went vnto land kergis conquered returne home people suffered extreame famine chaunce finding fresh entrailes beast cast away dung sodde brought cyngis eate thereof hereupon cyngis enacted neither bloud entrailes part beast might eaten cast away saue onely dung afterward slaine thunderclap leauing behind foure sonnes first occoday second thossut third thiaday name fourth knowne cyngis dead occoday occoday 2 • tartimp chosen emperor sent duke bathy nephew sonne thossut countrey altisoldan people called bisermini saracen spake language comania whome subdued thence marched orna port towne riuer many gazarians alanians russian saracen drowned riuer running citie turning chanell thence passed russia made foule hauocke destroying kiou chiefe citie proceeded hungarian polonians returne inuaded morduans pagan conquered battaile marched people called byleri bulgaria magna vtterly wasted countrey hence proceeded towards north people called bastarci hungaria magna hauing conquered subdued also parossitae samogetae thence proceeding vnto ocean sea time occoday sent cyrpodan kergis kergis subdued battaile pagan hauing beard haue custome father die token lamentation draw leather thong ouerthwart face one eare hence hee marched force southward armenian conquered part georgia receiuing tribute part thence dominion mightie soldan called deurum whome vanquished sight short went sacking conquering euen vnto soldan aleppo whose country subdued marched caliph baldach exacted hand daily tribute foure hundred byzantine besides baldakines gift thus farre conquest frier iohn aforesaid person bathy baydo court guine emperour haython haithon armen calleth baydo second sonne ocoday hoccota affirming sent three sonnes iochi west farre tygris baydo towards north chagoday towards south sent also one baydo whether another thirtie thousand horse epistle archbishop burdeaux recorded mat paris mat paris yeare 1243 sayth present summer departed hungarie layd siege neustat wherein yvo yeare 1246 frier iohn said baydo also rehearseth hungarian expedition returne vnto part volga etil likewise william de rubi uquis frier minorite sent baatu calleth lewes french king 1253 agreeth mathias à michon mat à michoude sarmat lib1 sarmatian historie witnesseth yeare 1241 tartar vnder bathu came russia destroyed kiou citie stately beautifull hauing three hundred church faire remaine day among shrubbes bryers receptacle wilde beast seat metropolitan vnder many bishop moldauia valachia russia muscouia sent peta polonia destroyed countrey ashwednesday turned cracouia ash abandoned prince people ouerthrew duke henrie nobleman force countrey assembled together pompo great master dutch order prussia battaile certaine tartarian standardbearer carrying great standard greeke letter x top staffe blacke terrible image long beard began tartarian sorcerie inchantment strongly shake head image whereupon smoake cloud intolerable stinke presently dispersed ouer polonians became heartlesse vnable fight duke henrie duke boleslan • pompo flower nobilitie slaine countrey miserably spoyled hence went morauia put fire sword moneth together thence hungarie bathy entred hungarie 500000 souldiors first ouerthrowing force king bela sent prohibit passage chased king himselfe power kingdome opposing himselfe field fled austria sclauonia leauing countrey prey tartar making spoile side danubius next winter passed ouer riuer frozen filled bloud slaughter bathy sent cadan pursue king scalauonia still fleeing wasted bosna seruia bulgaria two yeares sackage hungarie passed fennes maeotis tartaria happily returned make fresh spoyles europe embassage pope innocent diuerted purpose rather occoday great cham time poysoned expect new commission successor cuine installed euen presence frier iode plano c iohn pope legat erected banner time died left empire mangu whome aytonus hait • onus de tart armenian king went voluntarily person yeare 1257 receiuing gracious entertainement made vnto seuen petition first people become christian secondly bee perpetuall peace betweene tartar christian thirdly country conquered tartar church clergiemen christian free seruitude tribute fourthly would redeeme holy sepulchre holy land saracen fifthly would destroy caliph baldack sixtly himselfe might haue aid need require defence tartar neere vnto armenia seuenthly part armenia saracen possessed tartar recouer might returne crowne armenia mangucan answered deliberation noble first himselfe would christian persuade subiects force none thereunto rest order request fulfilled end would send brother haolon part alreadie shewed thus mangu baptized bishop chauncellor armenia household many noble sex ierusalem could recouered mangu died cobila cublai cublai 5 imp succeeded whose time paulus mpaull2 eyewitnesse tartarian proceeding affirmeth cublas exceeded power predecessours onely kingdomes christian saracen although ioyned one obtained soueraignetie shewed himselfe valiant souldior emperour neuer fought field naians vncle able prouinces wherein gouerned bring together foure hundred thousand horse whome caidu haue added hundred thousand horse conspired master lord cublai force ioyned cublai stopping passage none might passe carrie newes suddenly assembled within tenne dayes iourney cambalu three hundred threescore thousand horse hundred thousand footman 1286 power riding day night hee came suddenly enemy hauing sempre alla volta di graco tramontana whereas course directly east inclining south must haue beene taken china beene catai neither likely iourney would haue beene much letted frost snowes may bee mentioned others goe farre yet place cambalu farre within land paulus saith within two day iourney sea seemeth great tartarian prince hath strength sea therefore lesse knowne participate great mighty city tartarian cathayan kingdome although remaine yet vnknowne knew kingdome china hundred yeares agoe hath sailed way seeke since long knowne world prince world great negus aboue mentioned aethiopia especially hee hauing ship warre marchandise many scarse good hauens sea make himselfe knowne within land nature hath vvere imprisoned barring vp passage mountaines desert seemeth case cathayan furthered iealousie many great prince admit forreiner license passe feare innouation sed plenum aleae est saith scalihde rebsinarum scaliger de ijs aliquid statuere quae nobis per caliginem duntaxat nota sunt hard determine misty mystery euen nature fall sunne shine many howers ariseth v historie may happen may shine tartarian sunne cathay darke night longinquitie distance hideth eye let euery reader iudge pleaseth afraid betwixt cathay china shall get checke staying longer becommeth pilgrim let v therefore minde pilgrimage take view tartarian religion thankes iesuites paine loth follow others make silke doe much honour place faire chariot couered doore flation whosoeuer stealeth thing chariot slaine without pitty captaines haue one alway middest tent idol offer first fruit milke first morsel meate first draught drinke meales kill beast offer heart idoll leauing till morning take eate make idoll also chiefe emperour offer thereunto great solemnitie well creature horse none dare ride till death breake bone beast kill meate burne fire bend themselues idoll toward south god worship sunne light fire water also earth offering thereunto first meates drinkes morning eate drinke haue set rite prescribed lawe doe compell deny religion simply although customes rigorous thus martyred michael duke russia refused doe reuerence image cingis beene first emperour compelled yonger brother andrew duke saruogle russia marry said brother wife according custome slaine former husband haue certaine tradition according reckon thing following sinnes sinnes thrust knife fire way touch fire knife knife take flesh cauldron hew hatchet neare fire thinke cut away head fire account sinne also leane whip wherewith beate horse ride spurres also touch arrowes whip take kill yong bird strike horse raine bridle breake one bone another likewise poure meate milke kinde drinke vpon ground make water within tabernacle whosoeuer doth willingly slaine otherwise must pay great summe money inchanter bee purified causeth tabernacle thing therein passe betweene two fire besides hath morsell giuen hee able swallow cause casteth mouth hole made vnder tabernacle hee drawne forth slaine without compasion likewise whosoeuer treades vpon threshold duke tabernacle hee put death thus gnattes strayned vvhen hostile inuasions murther camel easily amongst swallowed thinke death shall liue another world multiply cattell eate drinke doe action life new moone full moone begin new enterprise call great emperour bow knee pray thereto sunne say moones mother hath thence light sorcery giuen diuinations augury soothsaying witchcraft inchantments receiue answere diuell attribute vnto god call itoga comanians call cham emperor maruellously feare reuerence offering many oblation first fruit meate drinke according answeres dispose thing beleeue thing purged fire therefore embassadours prince personage whatsoeuer come vnto gift must passe betweene two fire purified least peraduenture haue practised witchcraft haue brought poison mischiefe fire fall heauen vpon men beast often hapneth thinke themselues way defiled vncleane thus purified inchanters sicke speare set vp tent blacke felt welted thenceforth stranger entreth therein sicknes funeral none present death may enter hord duke emperour till new moone dead chiefe man buried field pleaseth buried tent sitting middest thereof hee may haue world tabernacle thing fitting vse bury golde siluer chariot cart carried forth broken tent destroyed neither lawfull name name till third generation obserue also funerall rite long condition men obedient lord tartar seldome contend word neuer deedes reasonably courteous one another woman chaste adulterie seldome heard theft rare punished death drunkennesse common without bralls goe according direction astrologer magician eight twentith august aforesaid spendeth powreth forth owne hand milke mare aire earth giue drinke spirit idol worship may preserue men woman beast bird corne thing growing earth sect order astrologer necromancer art maruellous skie cloudie threatneth raiue ascend roofe palace grand cause raine tempest fall round without touching said palace thus doe called tebeth chesmir tebeth chesmir two fort idolater delude people opinion sanctitie imputing workes dissembled holinesse cause goe filthy beastly manner caring seeth dirt face neuer washing combing themselues condemned death take dresse eate doe die naturally bachsi also called bachsi religion order one say frier preacher minor exceedingly expert diuelish art cause bottle hall great doe fill bolles owne accord also without man helpe passe ten pace aire hand said hath drunke like sort returne place bachsi sometimes resort vnto officer threaten plague misfortune idol preuent desire many mutton blacke head many pound incense lignum aloe performe due sacrifice accordingly receiue offer feast day sprinkling broth idol boe great monastery seeme like small citie whereof two thousand monkes shaue head beard weare religious habite hallow idol feast great solemnitie hymnes light may bee married otherthere called sensim sensim order obserueth great abstinence strictnesse life life eating nothing branne put hot water let stand till white meale taken away eate beeing thus washed worship fire condemned heretikes worship idoles marry case shauen weare hempengarments blacke bright yellow although silke yet would alter colour sleepe great matte liue austerest life world astrologer cambalu fewer fiue thousand christian catayans saracen maintained foode rayment great can charge astrolabe foretell change weather mortality warres disease c enterprise great worke resorteth vnto telling houre natiuitie art informed successe hold soule immortall according euery man merit life passe noble creature till deified ignoble pesant dogge degree vilest shew much reuerence parent whome vngratefull necessity office officer appointed trie punish offence emperours hall none dare spit purpose carieth little vessell spit dare make noyse lowd talking tartar first vncharitable poore would curse saying god loued would haue prouided idolatrous bachsi commended almes good worke great prouision made euery day least twenty thousand dish rice mill panike certaine officer distributed amongst liberality adore god cingis amongst first lawes enacted saith vincentius punishment vincent bel spechistorlib 30ca 70 death inflicted vpon offender three vice time rife amongst namely lying adultery theft yet towards men tartar made conscience great vsurers taking tenne hundred moneth besides vse vpon ca75 vse insomuch souldier georgia borrowed fiue hundred peeces coine called yperpera retaining fiue yeares constrained repay seuen thousand tartarian ladie seuen yeares vse fiftie sheep demaunded seuen thousand yperpera couetous though abound cattell scarce allow owne expence found good die sicke addicted sodomie buggerie ca 76 eate sometimes necessity man flesh sometimes delight themselues sometimes terrifie others reckoning great glory haue slaine many varietie cruelty ca 77 head shaue eare eare manner horseshooe wearing long locke eares neckes tartar see father grow iesuites conuerted one man neere vnto nanquin thirtie yeares togither obserued fast strange among chinois neuer eating flesh fish thing feeding temperately vsurers punished china losse money emploied priest shewed haue secular regular scalant ap ortel one weareth long haire blacke clothes hath priuate habitation liue couents shauen neither may marry though doe alone far worse much commend bookes nic longobar consideration examination man selfe therefore esteeme highly sequester themselues humane society diuine contemplation say may restore themselues thēselues pristine state wherein heauen created therfore haue onely colledges learned men leauing affaire state secular distraction doe priuate village liue together obseruing contemplation mutual conference euen woman also haue nunnery liue monasticall life vnder abbess manner although euen married liue closely enough feete ende straitly swaddled infancy grow little haue little feete • great commendation whereby lamely walke abroad widdow refuse second marriage shee obtaineth hereby much praise many priuiledges bonzij little accounted iesuites wearing habite little set therefore taking mandarinehabit apparell learned men one statue fiftie pace long sacred father men thinke sent aboue borne certaine person suffered martyrdome loue god priest clothed yellow long garment colour esteemed holy euerie yellow thing resemblance hath gold sunne hallowed god besides said strict order may nourish hennes female sexe drinke wine punished priest stoning haue many fast yeare one especially people frequenteth temple sermon haue canonicall houres day night holy thing hold world shall last eight thousand yeares whereof sixe thousand passed shall consumed fire time shall opened heauen seuen eye sunne shall drie vp water burne vp earth ash shall remaine two egges whence shall come forth one man one woman shall renew world shall salt fresh riuers lake shall cause earth without man labour abound plentie good thinges siamites sinke easterue superstition deriue manie nation inhabitant kingdome much giuen pleasure riot refuse vse manuall art addict themselues husbandrie haue maginus gbotben publike schooles teach lawes religion vulgar language science learne learned tongue worship innumerable idol especially foure element according sect man maketh choise buriall worshipped earth therein buried fire burneth dead carkasses obserued ayre hanged feast ayriewinged people flesh adored ayre aliue water drowneth aliue beene drowned waterie religion euery king first entrance crowne erecteth temple adorneth high steeple innumerable idol citie socotay one mettall fourescore spannes high kingdome siam comprehendeth aurea chersonesus ptolomey described arrianus periplus mappe whereof ortelius set paam ior malacca possession portugal kingdomes aua chencran caipumo brema haue shared also therein odia ioanbarl9c2 chiefe citie thereof containing foure hundred thousand household serueth king fiftie thousand souldiors riuer capiumo standeth belong two hundred thousand vessel king hath nine kingdomes subiect thirtie thousand elephant whereof three thousand trained warres noble hold land kind knightsseruice like turkish timars yet onely terme life without king pay serue whensoeuer appointeth twentie thousand horse two hundred fiftie thousand foot countrey compassed high hill iangoma brema brama aua selfe plaine situation fertilitie caused inundation like aegypt lai tributary siam feare gueoni caniballa maneaters liuing mountaines adiacent whome siamite defendeth inuaded gueoni one time men lay 21moneths 500000 fresh souldiors sent supply yet preuailed treason furthered designes force gate one night set open peguans entred siamite perceiued poysoned himselfe leauing child kingdome balby merchant saw weeping maister nothing might comfort although hee continually two seruants attending telling amended estate vnder mightier maister yet would hee scarce cease weepe beginne eate presented themselues kneeling yea onely kneeled white elephant also king dieth make two shippes golden couers betwixt erect golden theater place corpse applying thereto muske sweet wood thing set forth sea setting theater pagcant fire one shippes talapoies sing till thinke body consumed ash make masse lumpe ash milke commit sea hauen sirian ebbing water bone remaine carry place erecting throne kingdome c nizamaluco also called nizamoxa xa seha persian title signifying iosscalcanisagl3 monsiour france spaine giuen ismael sophi tamas sonne king would communicate sect nizamoxa onely yeelded made shew soone recanted thus farre garcias religion cambaia partly moorish partly heathenish vertomannus lveril4 author worship idol pagodes others report way others exceeding religiously deuoted obserue strict kind • man pinner fasting lasteth eight dayes others fifteene twentie thirtie dayes space cate bit onely thirst drinke water one could see make end penance till left eye fell head done heart cambaia one bramene reputation holinesse honour would salute medled worldly affaire one affirmed iesuite bramene commaund distribute good poore would doe yea would lay downe life commaund eight day ianuarie do1595 citie giuen almes twentie thousand pardawes value flemish dollar one man giuen fiue thousand thereof another three thousand another fifteene hundred cause day bramenes affirmed sunne departed sur horte pilgrimage spoken eastward ganges westward mecca wit moore men alone woman also mahomet hath forbidden vnmarried woman holy iourney marrie set forth dissolue marriage againe returne hereby thinke purchase merit god went one day sayth pinnerus publike hospitall citizen cambaia founded kindes bird cure sicknesse peacockes incurable therefore might haue beene expelled hospitall alacke pitie rufull accident hawke beene admitted thither cure lame legge whole inhospitally slew many cohospitall weaker fowles therefore expelled birdcolledge master thereof men hospitall thus hospitall fowles haue certaine religious person called verteas religious cambaia liue colledg • together went house fiftie number ware white cloth bareheaded shauen word might applyed pull haire head face leauing little crowne liue almes receiue surplusage daily foode giueth wiuelesse order sect written booke guzarates writing drinke water hote physicke deuotion supposing water hath soule slay dranke vnsodden cause beare hand certaine little brush sweepe floore sit downe walke least kill soule worme small creature saw priour thus generall order said haue hundred thousand men vnder canonicall obedience newly chosen euery yeare saw amongst little boyes eight nine yeares old resembling countenance europe rather india parent consecrated order mouth cloath foure finger broad let thorow eares hole brought backe againe thorow eares would shew cause perceiued lest gnat flie enter thither slaine teach world made many hundred thousand yeares agoe god send three twentie apostle hath sent foure twentieth third age two thousand yeares since time haue writing em pinner author another epistle saith inhabitant cambaia bramenes eat flesh kill thing yea redeeme beast bird maimed sicke carry hospital cured guzzarat seene many gioghi religious order monkes yeeld none penance pouertie goe naked cold weather sleepe dunghils vpon heap ash couer head face saw place one gioghi kept middest citie amadeba conceit holinesse resorted number people shore lisbone returne indian fleet gioghi sent prince sultan morad son mogor refused come one ficritus reporteth like gymnosophist bidding prince come enough holy saint end whereupon prince caused apprehended soundly whipped banished people killeth kine nourisheth mother saw amadeba cow readie die offered fresh grasle draue fly gaue attendance two three day till dead league halfe citie saw certaine coemiterium buryingplace neuer seene fairer sight wherein beene buried one cazis master king guzarat crected fabrike three iniury kill presence entreatie resist hainous sinne take away life god hath imparted soule bodie word preuaile offer money eat radish onyons garlike kinde herbe hath red colour egges thinke bloud drinke wine vse vineger water would rather starue eat countreymen happened sailed goa cochin portugall shippe spent store time falling longer made account would touch meat wash themselues euery time eate ease themselues make water vnder haire haue starre vpon forehead rub euery morning little white sander tempered water three foure grain rice among bramenes also doe superstitious ceremony law sit 1c14 concerning deuotion hee saith king calycut bramene predecessor also custome king die one pagode idol temple elected cause alwaies must house king serue idol serueth dieth must king raigneth leaue empire goe serue place another elected succeede kingdome refuseth forsake court pagode enforce therevnto king malabar bee browne men goe naked girdle vpward thence downe ward couered cloth silke cotton adorned iewels child sonnes inherit brother bee none sister sonne daughter ten yeares old send kingdome nayro presenting giftes request take virginitie hauing done tieth iewell necke shee weareth life token thenceforth hath free power body doe might death funerall rice king carried forth plaine field burned sweet wood costly kindred nobilitie country present done ash buried shaue themselues without leauing haire except browes eyelid euen least child space thirteene day cease eate lease see cap 12 betele lip cut doth time interregnum wherein obserue come obiect thing new future king inauguration new king hee sworne lawes predecessor pay debt recouer whatsoeuer belonged kingdome lost oath hee taketh hauing sword left hand right candle burning hath ring gold vpon hee toucheth two finger taketh oath done throw poure vpon graines rice many ceremony prayer worshippeth sunne three time caymailes principall noble sweare feal • ie handling also candle thirteene day ended eate betele againe flesh fish king except taketh thought predecessor space one whole yeere obserued part barbosa eates betele shaueth beard cutteth nailes eateth day doth washeth body observeth certaine houres prayer daily yeare ended obserueth kinde dirige predecessor soule whereat assembled hundred thousand person time giueth great almes confirmed malabarkings haue one especiall man cheefe administrator iustice matter gouernment obeyed lesse king himselfe souldiors nayros none bee imprisoned put death ordinarie iustice one kill another else kill cowe sleepe countrywoman speake euill king king information giues warrant another nayro vvith associate kill wheresoeuer finde hewing sword hang warrant testifie cause death nairos may weare weapon enter combat till bee armed knight although age seuen yeares trained vp feates practise armes hee dubbing nairos dubbed created king commandeth gird sword laying right hand vpon head muttreth certaine word softly afterward dubbeth saying haue regard keep bramenes kine yeeld themselues man seruice binde themselues die faithfully performe fighting till killed great soothsayer haue good bad dayes worship sunne moone fire kine first meete morning deuill often say one pagodes causeth vtter terrible word goeth king naked sword quaking cutting flesh saying great cry god come tell thee thing king doubteth roareth lowder cutteth himselfe deeper till credited portugalls haue much eclipsed greatnesse king calycu • caused many alteration east last age world whose exploit castaneda barrius maffaeus osorius others haue written egypt 4 sect differing frō canon ciuill aws mahumetans professeth one sect cannot pleasure betake another except learned bee shew reason therefore sect hath peculiar iudge yet lieth appeale higher iudge gouernour sect called essafichia whosoeuer attempteth ought precept owne sect secretly punished iudge thereof although priest seuerall sectes vse differing liturgy rite example christian ending controuersies religion yet doe take one enemy hatred mutiny question arise learned men conference debate man vpon paine grieuous punishment may reproch foure doctor first author foure sect one sect religious men cairo called chenesia liue vpon horseflesh therfore lame iades bought set vp fatting sold chenesians sect rise asia goe certaine woman vp citie cry whose office excise circumcise woman obserued egypt syria mabumetans iacobite christian neither haue turkes although superstition themselues acknowledged short arabian aegyptians beene altogether idle deu • tion testifie pilgrimage good called barbaria either barbar signifieth murmure seemed speech inhabitant arabian word bar signifieth desart doubled comprehendeth magin mauritania africa minor libya exterior besides cyrenaica marmarica whereof haue spoken inhabitant fetch palestina arabia conquered romanes taken greeke emperours vandal againe saracen arabian partly subiect turke partly xeriffe vsually diuided foure kingdomes marocco fesse tremisen tunis barca said alreadie kingdome tunis containeth ancient called africa propria minor numidia antiqua soyle fertile especially west part inhabitant sound healthfull gezeir spaniard algier old called mesgana african family founded containeth hath eightie thousand person boterus affirmeth foure thousand family building sumptuous innes bathstoues temple beautifull euery occupation hath seuerall place selfe hath adioyning plaines pleasant fertile one whereof fiue forty mile long almost thirtie broad many yeares subiect kingdome telensin hearing bugia gouerned embassadour algier spaine whence brought three thousand bookes written arabian while tunis heard barbarussa slaine telensin brother hariaden turkish admirall cairadin succeeded told also emperour ann 1541 charles himselfe imperiall nauy passed sea like purpose effect ouercomming himselfe patient bearing loss enemy sought assaile moued expedition complaint subiects turkish pirats vnder asanaga barbarussas lieutenant infested sea tempestuous weather land sea disappointed losse many men shippes forced returne make roome souldiers caused horse gallant breed notwithstanding bee cast ouerboord thus doth algier still continue sinke pirats saith maginus many lesse fiue twenty thousand christian slaues likelihood time encreased tripoli also seat turkish viceroy beglerbeg turkish rouers kingdome telensin desert angad wherein store roe deere ostrich arabian theeues lion castle izli sometime stored inhabitant stately walled since inhabited religious person much reuerenced king telensin arabian giue free entertainment three dayes vnto trauellers little runneth riuer water field else would yeeld fruit guagida betwixt two stooles vnquiet sitting paying tribute king telensin arabiās ned rom built roman name testifieth ned signifieth like like historiographer faile vnto rome heere tebecrit dwelt great store weauers haresgol sometime famous destroyed king patriarch cairaoan bequeathed seemeth greatnes therof telensin grew renowne towne giues name kingdom abu tesfin reigned sixteene thousand family ioseph king fesse besiege •• seuen yeares together almost famished slaine treason found victual enough enemy camp assailed spoiled reliefe forty yeares abulhesen king fez thirty month siege tooke beheaded king many beautifull temple hauing mahumetan priest preacher likewise fiue college sumptuously built king telensin fesle curiously wrought musaike worke arabian mus student haue maintenance bathe innes iomit great part city inhabited iewes distinguished yellow turbants great city rather ruined war far hence leo time kept famous heremit much esteemed holinesse short time grew rich horse cattell none region cōparable paid nothing king arabian supposed saint told disciple saith leo tenth corne eight thousand bushel yeare rich heremite hath fiue hundred horse mare ten thousand small cattel two thousand ox besides hath yearely sent diuers part world almes offering betweene foure thousand fiue thousand duckats fame spread ouer asia africa disciple fiue hundred dwell liue charge enioyneth neither penance labour reade ordinary prayer giues name god night secret roomes shewed among thing bookes magike alchimy would haue proued magike true science whereby thought magician saw much honored yet vsed neither saying doings inuocations god certaine religion lost gouernment part said turkish beglerbeg hath chiefe title dinano hath chiefe power iudgments iurisdiction corasan captaine ianizaries many matter great beglerbeg beglerbegs algier tune make principall profit place hold three yeares hauing first bought deare rate piracy ioynt consent exercise sea manner fish come net meet conueniently notwithstanding league peace holden grand signor also giue entertainment pirats place resort either sell illgotten good ioyne strength late pirate dansker warde haue beene famous infamie first seruice receiuing reward suddenly killed tune knowne notwithstanding disguising himselfe purpose haue surprised fleet shame countrey grew rich piracy shewed one time author report iohn pountesse bagge iewels containing almost halfe bushell besides purchase last end might manifest wickednesse proceeding many english christian vnworthy either name turne faith neuer profession professe themselues hell turkish became apostata renegado faith soone died tune leauing good goodnesse left vnto turkes body vnto forren sepulchre soule let pirats robber thinke haue soule say whither algier barbarussa subiected turke yeare 1534 tune 1574 three twentie year tripoli barbary another cage like bird seat beglerbeg taken knight malta sinan bassa kingdomes turke hath africa besides great kingdome egypt hath taken prester iohn egypt knolles said hundred insufficient place goe saith author six time foure twentie houres oftner written turkes except sabbath praiers first washing themselues doe also office nature company wiues thinking thereby washed praiers talby sits downe spends halfe houre resoluing doubt shall moue question matter law second time prayer two houres day third noone fourth foure clock afternoone fift twilight last two houres hold vncleane doe right hand sabbath friday exempted worke deuout going church church faire generally christendome haue seat ornament bel floores matted also poore part churchman lyturgie short long pater • oster creed set forme haue euery one praies owne pleasure although moore may haue foure wiues many cōcubines purchase yet marry foure wiues friend haue sufficient bill dowrie maintenance none rich men performe againe wiues challenge night company course neglected shee complaines magistrate forceth husband dutie else send home dower bill diuorce concubine embraced stolne pleasure bill dower holdeth husband awe else would make slaue wife still change yonger flesh bride bedded husband see find virgin may turne home keepe portion law funerall rite one dead presently wash speedily put ground transcribed theophanes heere first persia chorost •• second egypt third africa fourth philistiem rhamble fift damascus sixt chemps emessa seuenth chalep eight antiochia ninth charan tenth emet eleuenth esipe twelfth musel thirteenth ticrit africa shooke yoke ameras bagdad amera owne afterwards occasion weakenesse amera bagdad amera persia chorasan freed himselfe also called himselfe amerumnes wearing alcoran hanging downe necke table like chaine saith kindred alem amera egypt amera arabia faelix alway beene subiect became also owne man calling himselfe amerumnes deriuing pedigree alem giues light saracen historie generall sheweth greatnesse arabian saracenicall power africa first made head maisters time said elagleb deputy amera cairaoan whose example became president ameras persia egypt present purpose occasion spreading superstition africa fountaine sinke thereof n • w farre damasco bagdad heart africa satan chusing throne vicar chaliphas word saith ••• scal ••• li3 chalipha est vicarius quonomine ••• qui ••• ••• ••• ••• sunt qui dunas bonomis ••• scaliger signifieth haue heard faithfull infidelitie haue mentioned scaligers interpretation word chal • pha bee amisse adde place first gouernors generalls mahumet calles muhammed called emirelmumenin captaines orthodox right beleeuers afterwards vnder colour religion sought onelie priestly primacie tyrannicall monarchie chose rather called chalipha first emirelmumenin abubecher successours sent lieutenant africa spaine gouerned vnder name emirelmumenin although nothing manner title wanting fulnesse power themselues entituled themselues emire elmumenin deputy became king done petite king spaine gouernours africa king marocco fesse vseth proper name french king called christianisimus spanish catholicus thus farre scaliger serueth glosse former name amera amerumnes chalipha miramuldinus many hence corrupted meanes saracen enlarging sect haue beene principally armes force trafficke preaching 200 yeares death mahamet barbarie infected pestilēce leolib1 side ethiopia eue cabo de los corientes kingdomes magadazo melinde mombazza quiloa mosambique besides ilands saint laurence others greatest mischiefe happened africa arabian soure hundreth yeare hegeira time mahumetan chaliphas ameras forbidden arabian passe ouer nilus tent family countrey still peopled auncient inhabitant howsoeuer gouerned multitude vnbrideled barbarous nation likely proue dutifull subiects empire time eone elcain schismaticall chalisa cairaoan part shewed hauing generall gehoar conquered westerne part farre sus employed man valour conquest east egypt together syria subdewed elcain himselfe seeing chalipha bagdet made preparation withstand aduice gehoar time sounded cairo passed egypt thinking inuest himselfe saracenicall soueraignetie committing gouernement barbary prince tribe zanhagia absence lord compacted chalipha bagdet acknowledged title barbarie receiuing reward treason bagdet prelate kingdome africa elcain hauing lost morsell snatch shadow great perplexitie course take tilla counsellor perswaded hee might gather great summes gold would let arabian haue free liberty passe egypt africa though knew would waste spoiles remaine vnprofitable himselfe enemy yet incited two vehement orator couetousnesand reuenge last granted permitted arabian would pay ducat peece freely passe receiuing promise would becom deadly enemy rebel cairaoan whereupon tenne tribe kindred arabian halfe people arabia deserta multitude also arabia faelix writeth ibnu rachu famous historian leo hath drawne great part african historie accepted condition passing desarts tooke tripoli sacked cape eight moneths siege entred cairaoan filling bloud emptying spoile place preuailed thus kindred arabian settle themselues partes forced prouinces adiacent tribute remayned lord africa till ioseph founded marocco aided posteritie rebell brake yoke city tributary mansor fourth king chalipha sect muoachedin begunne said elmahels abdul mumen preferred arabian induced make warre vpon enemy easily conquered also brought chiefe principall arabian westerne kingdomes assigned noble place habitation wit prouinces duccala azgar meane condition appoynted numidia first slaues numidian recouered liberty obtained dominion part numidia assigned euery day encreasing power inhabited azgara place alcadam cadamosto went budomel prince whereof great respect people come presence kneele knee bowing head ground cast sand ouer shoulder head hand goe towards knee speake cast sand ouer shoulder still head bowed downe prince scarcely deigning looke word euery light offence would sell wiues child suffered author goe moschee arabian chaplaines manner mumbled mattens tenne twelue time halfe houre companie rising falling againe earth kissing also heard willingly confute mahumetane proue christian faith said thought harder christian saued negro god iust god lord giuen v many good thing world nothing comparison therefore world haue paradise wanted easily might haue beene turned christianitie feare loosing state wiues prouide diet vsuall among negro none priest principall men eate beastly sort lying ground dish set middest taking meat hand eate little eate often foure fiue time day october iune raines haue great serpent many vse charme prince would poyson weapon reported make great circle enchaunted charmes serpent thereabouts thereinto killed seemed venomous letting rest goe bloud thereof seed certaine tree tempered poyson purpose weapon infected drawing neuer little bloud kill quarter houre haue great store parrats instructed maruellous naturall cunning preuent serpent would else destroy neasts build therefore high tree end tender bough thereof fasten bullrush hang downe two spannes thereunto weauing working neast sort serpent feare falling dare aduenture deale therewith negro came cadamosto wonder see apparrell whitenesse colour neuer seene christian spittle rubbed skinne see whither whitenesse naturall perceiuing tincture measure astonished would giue nine sometimes foureteene slaues horse furnished buy horse bring enchaunters make fire hearbes set horse ouer smoake vttering certaine wordes annoint thinne ointment shut vp twentie dayes none may see hanging certaine trumperie necke thinking hereby secure battaile gunnes seemed hideous noyse deuill indeede saw direct course sea said christian could thus make voyage sea great enchaunters comparable deuill themselues ynough doe trauell land seeing candle burne night knew make light fire esteemed loue dogges better flesh sat shamble andrew battell told dogges country one sort prickeared curres meane bignes vse also hant open cannot barke therefore hang clapper made little boords neckes hath seene mastiffe sold three slaues lopez affirmeth great dog exchanged two twenty slaues might happen vpon extraordinary occasion money angola glassebeads vse also said ornament king angola hath seemed willing become christian hath sent king congo purpose could obtaine priest scarcity instruct kingdome hath many lordship subiect thereto farre seacoast c negro towards lake called aquelunda lieth countrey called quizama inhabitant whereof gouerned manner commonwealth haue shewed themselues friendly portugal helped warres angola house angola made fashion like beehiue woman first sight new moone turne vp bummes despight offended menstruous course ascribe vnto men sometimes valorous resolution deuote themselues vnto haughty attempt warres taking leaue king vow neuer returne till bring horsehead thing dangerous enterprise either doe die horsetailes great iewels two slaues giuen one taile commonly bring riuer plate horse exceedingly encreased growne wilde fiering grasse round hemme horse fiery circle fire still streightning approching neerer till haue aduantage enough kill thus haue europaean cattell horse kine encreased world spare kill one hide tailes next angola northward od lobel gerard herba • sts mangle name tree multiplieth selfe wood haue obserued branch descending taking roote earth plane tree india hath leaues sufficient couer man foote head coco indian tree east also wherewith exceedingly drunke first sleepe boile end place first cause champed maid place olde woman make leaven thereof boyle make inebriating drinke cane leaues serue mole eate boyle drinke also paine backe bud may serue fleed butter oile part make bread great roote called yuca name cacavi first cut straine presse iuyce deadly poyson cake dried sleeped water eate another kind yuca iucca iuyce whereof poyson keepe long like biscuit vse bread hispaniola cuba iamaica wheat may wil grow vnequally one inflant grasse graine vse place another roote called papa like grownd nuttes bread call chuno francis first king france sent thither iames berton henry sonne nicolas villagnon greatest rich found diamond canada small value brittlenes thus boterus iaques iaq cart 1 cartier made three voyage part first yeare 1534 gladly welcomed sauages singing dancing expressing signes ioy rubbing armes hand lifting vp heauen giuing naked skinne though worse nothing trifle hee gaue went naked sauing priuities couered skinne certaine old skinnes cast vpon saw whose head altogether shauen except one bush haire offer grow vpon top crowne long horse taile tied vp leatherstrings knot haue dwelling boat turne vpside downe vnder lay themselues along bare ground eat flesh fish almost raw little heated coales next yeare captaine iaq car 2 cartier returned carried backe two sauages carried france learne language hee passed vp hochelaga wintered time countrey found rat liued water big cony good meat hochelaga city round compassed timber three course rampiers one within another framed sharpe two rod high hath one gate shut pile barres fifty great house middest euery one court middle whereof make fire came forced leaue boat behinde certaine fall heard three higher vp streame towards sanguenay iaq car 3 third voyage discouered concerning religion part canada euen amongst sauages finde tract footprint therof neither dreadful winter haue quite frozen death great deep water haue wholly drowned shadow thereof appeareth shadowes men howsoeuer wilde sauage like giue entertainment people beleeueth saith iaques iaq car 2 cap 10 cartier one call cudruaigni say often speaks tele weather follow whether good bad moreouer angry cast dust eies beleeue die goe star thence little little descend downe horizon euen star doe go certaine greene field full goodly faire precious tree flower fruit frenchman told cudruaigni diuell acquainted mystery christian religion wherupon condescended desired baptisme french excused promised bring priest purpose liue common together commodity countrey yeeldeth well stored wed two three wiues man husband dead neuer marry againe widowes liuery weare blacke weed day life besmearing face coledust grease mingled together thicke backe knife haue filthy detestable vse marrying maiden first putting lawfull age marry common place harlot free euery man haue vntil time finde match haue seene house full prostitute schooles france full child vse much misrule riot wantonnesse dig ground certaine peeces wood big halfe sword sow maiz men also doe much vse tobacco woman labour men fishing husbandry hardy beast would come ship starke naked going vpon snow ice season take great store beast stag beares marterns hare fox whose flesh eate raw hauing first dried sunne smoke doe fish haue also otter weasils beauers badger cony fowle fish great varietie kalls networke hee requited great humanitie men went naked woman knit loose garment bullrush middle came second time brought feather bagges tabacco long oration one speaker rest left bowes hill came followed clothed conyskinnes people came hauing face painted white blacke colour euery one bringing present euen child also scepterbearer made lowd speech halfe houre taking word whispered vnto solemne applause ended came downe hil order without weapon scepterbearer beginning song dancing wherein rest followed king diuers others made seuerall oration supplication generall become king king song set crowne generalls head put chaines necke honoring name hioh common sort leauing king guard scattered themselues sacrifice among people taking view best pleased fancie yongest offered sacrifice prouince hath many townes house flat roofed built lime stone street orderly placed people great stature haue face armes legges rased pownced new mexico many lake saltwater certaine time yeare waxeth hard becommeth good salt cacique kindly entertained victualles present especially hide chamois skinnes well dresled well flanders passing many dayes iourney northward came house foure story high well built stoues winter season men woman weare shooes boot good soales neats leather thing else seene indie prouince found many idoles worshipped particularly euery house oratory deuill whereinto ordinarily carry meate papist erect cross vpon highwayes haue people certaine high chappells well trimmed painted say deuill vseth take case recreate himselfe hee trauelleth one towne prouince tiguas sixteene townes one frier aforesaid slaine six league thence prouince los quire worship idoles neighbor saw certaine canopy wherein painted sunne moone many starres 37 ½ hence passed keeping still northerly course found prouince called cuuames fiue townes one chia contained eight market place house plaistered painted diuers colour presented curious mantle shewed rich mettalls beyond came ameies fifteene league thence acoma situate vpon rocke hath entrance ladder paire staires hewen rocke water kept cistern passed hence zuny spaniard call cibola found three spaniard left vasques forty yeres almost forgotten owne language westward hence came mohotze exceeding rich mine siluer likewise part seeme incline toward virginia haue heard inland discoueries spaniard nova albion sr francis drake let v take view spanish nauigation coast cortes conquerour mexico sent fran vlloa apud ramus hack vol3 francis de vlloa fleet discouerie yeare 1539 acapulco came santa cruz california sailed ouer gulfe came riuer saint peter saint paul beheld side goodly country loth hold voyage lest saile scope leaue offended reader behinde found course burning mountaines cast vp fire ash smoake great quantitie encountered cruell storme almost hope saw candle vpon shrowdes trinitie one shippes mariner said saint elmo saluted song prayer darkenesse popery worship naturall light yea hath little imperfect meteor perfect humane must participate diuine worship without gulfe california found store great fish suffered themselues bee taken hand also saw weedes floting sea fifty league together round full gourde vnder store fish store fowle grow fifteene twenty fadome depth caught dogges beast fat haired like goat otherwise resembling deere neither foure dug like vnto cowe full milke little dealing inhabitant leaue see fernando fer alarchon alarchon shew v discovery set forth antonio de mendosa viceroy yeare lord 1540 two shippes hee came bottome bay california found mightie riuer ranne surious violence could scarce saile • heere leauing shippes company hee passed vp peeces ordnance two boates drawing boates hal • er made vp riuer called buena guia incountered indian inhabitant forbade landing alarchon hurling weapon downe pulling certaine ware giue appeased fury caused also lay downe weapon receiue trifle gaue two league higher many indian came called dec •• strange manner painted face ouer halfe way others visards shape face • hole nosthrils whereat certaine pendant hung others ware shelles hauing eares full hole bone shels hanging thereat ware girdle waste whereunto fastned bunch feather hung downe behinde like taile carried bagges tabacco body traced cole haire cut hung long behind woman ware bunch feather behind foure men woman apparell alarchon perceiued signes thing reuerenced sunne therefore signified vnto hee came sunne whereat maruelled tooke curious view greater reuerence brought aboundance foode first flinging vp part euery thing aire turning giue part offering armes carry house else whatsoeuer hee would haue stranger came would goe meet cause lay downe weapon would would breake peeces hee gaue chiefe small ware needed pray help draw boate vp streame euery one laboured get hold rope otherwise beene impossible haue gotten vp current caused cross made giuen instruction honour extasie blinde zeale kissing lifting vp euery one comming till paper stickes enough purpose passed hee met one vnderstood interpreter asked many question answered sent sunne doubting sunne went skie said going rising came neere earth made land sent hither visit riuer people charge make warres one vpon another saith indian send sooner hee answered child long dialogue thus passed betwixt issue whereof indian cried would receiue lord seeing childe sunne came doe good vse hee make superstitious obseruation sunne worshipped hee made warme said caused croppe grow therefore thing eate cast little vp aire warre one vpon thing common sauages small occasion eldest valiant guided army place lord tooke warre burned plucked heart eate alarchon caused crosse made timber commanding owne people worship leauing indian instruction euery morning sunnerise kneele tooke great deuotion would suffer touch ground vntill knew questioning deepe set composition gesture worship like curiosity paganish christianitie told riuer inhabited three twenty language married one woman one man maides marriage conuersed men talked kept home wrought adultery death burned dead widowes staied halfe yeare whole yeare married againe euery family seuerall governor ruler none riuer vsed sometimes ouerflow bankes people told alarchon cevola many blew stone turqueses digged rocke stone governor died good buried eate napkin many waiting table killed negro mentioned said many brother whome thought would giue intelligence therefore killed old man tolde name two hundred lord people part olde man son clothed woman attire sort foure served sodomite sodomitical lust vnmaried franciscode gualle spanish captaine pilot master haklnit hath related hath labour like nature deeply engaged himselfe country good countrimen meriteth euerlasting name though knowne time portraiture industrious spirit hath beene admirall holding light vnto sea diligent guide land willingly yea dutifully acknowledge great part long wearisome pilgrimage chap ix new spaine conquest thereof hernando cortes wee safely arriued south spaniard call south sea otherside america sea north vnknowne land haue wildered selues wearied reader great spacious countrey new spaine new spaine lieth betweene florida california confines south guatimala iucatan came called asketh long discourse concerning conquest thereof cortes whose history thus related hernando gomara first part conquest west indie translated english nicolas cortes borne medellin andulozia prouince spaine 1485 nineteene yeares old sailed iland domingo ouando gouernour kindly entertained went conquest cuba yeare 1511 clerke
