kinde entertainment taken returned receiued kinde office told certaine bearded men yucatan whither cortes sent one geronimo de aguilar came vnto told shipwracke iamaia caruell lost twentie wandered boat without saile water bread thirteen fourteen day space violence current cast shore prouince called maija trauelled seuen died famine captaine valdinia foure sacrificed idol cacike lord countrey eaten solemne banquet six put coupe cage fatned another sacrifice breaking prison escaped another cacike enemy former rest died himselfe gonsalo guerrer marriner transformed himselfe indian cut boring nose full hole eares iagged face hand painted married wife became captaine name amongst indian would returne aguilar cortes new interpreter passed vp riuer tauasco called former discouerer grijalua towne stood thereon refusing victuall taken sacked indian enraged assembled armie fortie thousand cortes horse ordnance preuailed indian thinking horse rider beene one creature whose gaping swiftnesse terrible vnto wherevpon submitted themselues heard horse ney thought horse could speake demanded said spaniard answered horse sore offended fighting would haue corrected simple indian presented rose hennes beast desiring eate pardon cortes purposed discouer westward hee heard mine gold hauing first receiued vassallage king master said monarchie vniuersall appertaine first vassal emperour newspaine named towne thing done victorie called potonchan containing neere fiue twentie thousand house great made lime stone bricke mudwalls rafter couered straw dwelling vpper part house moistnesse soile eate man flesh sacrificed spaniard sayled westward came saint iohn de vlhna teudelli gouernour countrey came foure thousand indian reuerence captaine burning frankincense custome little strawes touched bloud owne bodie presented vnto victualls iewells gold curious workes feather cortes requited collar glasse thing small value woman slaue giuen potonchan vnderstood language shee aguilar interpreter cortes professed himselfe seruant great emperour sent thither whose power highly extolled teudilli maruelled thinking beene prince world master soucraigne king mexico whose vassall named mutezuma sent representation bearded men horse apparrell weapon ordinance rarity painted cotton clothes shippes number painted cotton sent post deliuered one another celeritie day night message came mexico two hundred tenne myles distant cortes demaunded whether mutezuma gold tendelli affirmed cortes replyed fellowes disease heart whereunto gold best remedie mutezuma sent many cotton cloathes diuers colour many tuffes feather two wheeles one siluer signe moone gold made like sunne hold god giue vnto colour mettalls like euery wheele two yard halfe broad part present esteemed worth twentie thousand ducat mutezuma also professed ioy heare great prince strange people promised prouision necessary vnwilling cortes come see pretended yet cortes persisted desire seeing mutezuma might acquaint himselfe knowledge part silly indian hauing neuer seene strange sight came daily camp see heard ordnance discharged fell downe flat thinking heauens fallen shippes thought god aire called quezalcouolt came temple backe daily looked amongst rest rather aloofe rest certaine indian differing habite higher gristle nose slit hanging ouer mouthes ring iet amber hanging thereat nether lippes also bored hole ring gold turkeslestones weighed much lippes hung ouer chinnes leauing teeth bare vglinesse accounted gallantrie vncouth deformitie onely brauery thou gallant readest deridest madnesse fashion thine eye dazeled lightnesse light cannot call selfereflected vanitie mightest see monsterlike fashion home fashionly monster thy selfe thy cloathes oathes thy gesture vesture make thy naked deformitie worse thus deformed nakednesse indeed seeme haue receiued hellish character may bodily representation old serpent thse new fashion striuing shall shape himselfe neerest mishapen vglinesse wherein indian iagges himselfe humane lineament swagger himselfe ciuill christian ornament fashionmonger haue made almost fashion forget selfe remembring forgetfulnesse indian new cut cortes caused come learned zempoallan citie distant thence dayes iourney lord sent see god come teucallis temple seemeth called shippes held conuersation indian subiect mutezuma onely holden force hee gaue certaine toyes glad heare indian zempoallan neighbour well affected mutezuma readie farre durst entertaine occasion warre sailed thence panuco passed riuer farther till came little towne temple little tower rich garment iewels ware spaniard cortes came good time reliefe men mutezuma caused mexican bridle rage presently renued mutezuma againe guardian spaniard caused speake people blow stone temple wounded whereof three day died cortes thousand tlaxoltecas helpe driuen flee mexico spaniard indian closely night yet alarme raised bridge broken much slaughter people made mexican treasure manner lost pursued also two hundred thousand field cortes good happe slay standardbearer whereupon indian forsooke field battell fought otumpan tlazcallan hee kindly entertained prepared fiftie thousand men whome onely worshipped without image offered fowles butterflie eagle remnant like beastly men yet found doe great hurt either cunning force spaniard reduced course seeme haue learned sauage nature wilde beast whome whome liue meanes came passe wilde mountainous people left best fertile part countrey vnpeopled certaine remote nation possessed whome called nauatalcas signifieth wellspeakers navatalcas ciuilitie came northerne part call new mexico navatalcas paint beginning first territorie manner caues seuen tribe men comming supputation bookes departure aboue eight hundred yeares since reducing accompt yeare lord 720 fourescore yeares stayed way cause whereof ascribe god spake visibly bad seeke new land signes notified thus proceeded seeking signes peopled best part still remouing habitation found fertile country leauing onely aged sicke wearie others remaine former leisurely proceeding entred land mexico yeare 902 accompt seuen nation came first suchimilcos next chalcas thirdly tepanetans fourthly tescuco tlalluicans sixt tlascaltecans helped spaniard conquer mexico therefore exempted tribute day expelled history say certaine gyants whome pretence friendship inuited plentifull rich whereupon went forth carrying idoll coffer reedes supported foure principall priest whome talked communicated oracle direction likewise gaue lawes taught ceremony sacrifice obserue nation idoll perswaded bathing themselues certaine lake remoue campe closely steale away cloathes whereat thus forsaken changed language manner life retaining alway hatred mexican peopled prouince culhuacan mexican bloud father side embassage demaunded obtained name god answere king culhuacan let grandchild goe serue god lieutenant rule gouerne creature whome wee liue lord night day windes let goe lord water land possesse mexican nation c hee solemnely welcommed mexican welcome art sayth many oration expressed acostas seuenth booke large full wittie inuentions rhetoricall flourish oratour vnto name poore house citie amongst weedes mudde thy poore father grandfather kinsfolkes endure pleaseth lord thing created remember lord thou commest defence resemblance vitzliputzli rest thy selfe endure new charge many word effect expressed mexican history reserued tradition child end learning heart president learned art oratorie sworne crowned crowne like duke venice name acamapixtli signifieth handfull reedes therefore carrie armory hand holding many arrowes reedes mexican time tributary tapanccans whose chiefe citie azcapuzalco iudging according nature enuie suspition much weaker much stronger saw neighbour thought oppresse strange policie imposing vncouth shew impossible tribute bring tapunecan king garden planted growing water distresse vitzliputzli taught doe casting earth vpon reedes grasse layed lake planting mouing garden maiz figges gourd thing time appointed carried growing ripe thing often since proued lake emulous lesse glorie accounted one wonder new world pensill garden towred vp ayre babylon reason man according naturall priuiledge subiecting vse rebellious element ayre water acamapixtli mexican king reigned fortie yeares died leauing choise chuse successour chose sonne vitzilovitli signifieth rich feather annointed ointment call diuine annoint idoll coronation thus lop de gom parti lopez de gomara sayth done high priest attyred pontificalibus attended many others surplice oyntment blacke inke blessed sprinkled foure time holy water made time consecration god put vpon head cloth painted bone skull dead men clothed blacke garment vpon blew painted figure skull bone hang lace bottle pouders whereby deliuered disease witchcraft offer incense vitzliputzli high priest tooke oath maintenance religion maintaine iustice lawes cause sunne giue light cloud raine earth fruitfull c lastly followed acclamation people cry god saue king daunces c crowned hauing receiued homage subiects obtained king azcapuzalco daughter wife sonne called chimalpopoca procured relaxation tribute father law deuout superstition hauing raigned thirteene yeares hee died sonne ten yeares old chosen roome soone slaine inhabitant azcapuzalco mexican enraged iniurie assembled themselues orator among many word tell sunne eclipsed darkened time returne suddenly choise another king agreed vpon izcoalt signifieth snake rasors source acamapixtls first king common people earnest new king peace tapanecans obtaining whereof would carrie god litter intercessor hindered tlacaellec king nephew resolute valiant young man also perill life vndertooke embassage azcapuzalco defied king annointing ointment dead manner common mexico herewith offended pacifie king indented lost field eate noble side promising ouercome become tributary enioyed much freedome labour field house become seruants warre peace fine valour tlacaellec generall enemy ouerthrowne citie sacked remainder made tributarie land good conquered diuided among conquerours reserued quarter mexico vse sacrifice cuyacan next place mexican conquest hauing inuited mexican banquet end thereof sent last seruice woman habites forced put izcoalt tlacaellec made know ruine manhood mexican subdued also suchimilcos cuitlavaca citie lake teseuco yeelded selfe izcoalt twelue yeares died moteçuma first chosen stead presently election conducted temple great trayne diuine harthso called regard continuall fire kept enthronized king drew bloud eares legges griffon tallons sacrifice congratulated many oration priest ancient captaines whereas accustomed election make great feast daunces wasted many light brought custome personally make warre prouince thence procure sacrifice feast god men performed chalco whence hee brought many captiues day coronation sacrificed eaten feast tribute brought great solemnitie prouince marching selfe besides innumerable present commers bountifully entertained poore clad new garment giuen king chalcas taken brother moteçuma would haue made king enioyning make high scaffold ascended thereon telling god would permit king traytor vnto countrey cast downe himselfe whose death moteçuma reuenged ruine whole nation conquering vnto north south sea two foot shoulder like elephant female bring forth yong nourish vdder like cowe haue seene eaten saith benzo taste like swine flesh eate grasse petmart dec3libr8 king hispaniola put one presented fisherman lake standing water liued fiue twenty yeares seruants came lake called matto motto shee would come receiue meate hand would ferried ouer lake shee willingly yeelded backe performed office faithfully yea shee hath carried tenne men singing playing spaniard wronged casting dart therefore called shee would plunge downe againe otherwise indian shee remayned officious shee would bee full play monkie would wrastle especially shee addicted one young man vsed feede proceeded partly docible nature partly taken young shee kept vp home king house bread fish liueth land water riuer swelling ouer bankes lake fish followed streame seene strange creature nicaragua call cascuij like blacke hogge small eye wide eares clouen feete short truncke snowt like elephant lowde braying hee would make men deafe naturall purse vnder bellie wherein shee putteth young hath bodie foxe handed footed like monkie battes partes terrible biting inhabitant neere riuer suerus differing rest eate man flesh next necke narrow extent land stretching betweene north south sea knitting two great peninsula north south america together nombre de dios signifieth name god occasioned word didacus niquesa liked well hee would carry golden thirst bee satisfied hee deceiued nature dropsie thirst fire quenched oyle receiues thence greater strength hee deceiued promise bringing southsea valboa named one prouince golden castile hee spake strife benzo libr • ca23 could eate drinke mettalles cruelty spaniard indian got would binde hand feete laying backes would poure gold mouthes saying insultation eate part1vol2 guinea discouered villalobos sent new spaine yeare 1543 going discouer moluccas inhabitant blacke hue wittie spaniard haue coasted seuen hundred league yet cannot tell whether isle continent hesselius gerardus hath largely set forth petition memoriall p fer de quir detecti • australis incogenit • peter ferdinandez de quir vnto king spaine discouerie southerne vnknowne land plantation wherein hee declareth vnto maiestie fourteene yeares space hee busied himselfe small endamagement state person length thereof hee equalleth vnto europe much asia thence extendeth caspian sea wealth rich call terrestriall paradise inhabitant affirmeth innumerable white like mulatos otherwise colour habite bodie diuersified neither haue king lawes art diuided warre one vpon another bowes arrowes bid feare nothing hee haue gold enough making great banquet brought last seruice cup full molten gold forced drinke saying glut thy selfe gold baldiuia entred chili foure hundred horse easily conquered part beene subiect king peru richer part held spaniard sent word sonnes god came teach word god would yeeld would shoot fire among indian would trie argument field great ordnance well mortall men rebelled whereas vsed carrie grasse folt spaniard horse conueyed weapon meanes assisted fellowes without wonne fort baldiuia would haue recouered lost himselfe haue heard euer since indeed miracle spaniard worke indie saith author asked indian christian againe asked bishop groome dozen yeares keepe mule others indian saue little washing cold ceremony know nothing religion indian haue liued quiet spaniard since king proclaimed free yet still hate christianitie franciscus f à vicrel5 de indis à victpria protesteth doth appeare christian religion beene propounded meet sort indian miracle heard contrary scandal villanies many impiety preaching conuersion romists boast gull european world muster miracle thousand profelites rather pitie enuie case altered since new generation ignatian brood hath taught especially spaniard whose serue better catholicisme let arnauldus arnauld iesuites tell saith haue indeed wrought miracle amongst indian among reckoneth conuerting pagan butcherly subuerting •• oting hispaniola keeping husband wiues diuers workes asunder old generation thus worne new preuented peru publike place torture within march wherein might put thousand torture draw forth confession hidden treasure escaped hanged themselues mountaines wiues child foot dogges land worried pearlefishing exposed rauening sharkes themselues dogged sharking brute
